steps.title: Create a new branch
steps.description: Start by creating a feature branch from main.
steps.notes: This creates and switches to a new branch in one command.

steps.title: Make your changes
steps.description: Stage your modified files for commit.
steps.notes: The dot means "add all changed files in the current directory."

steps.title: Commit with a message
steps.description: Save your changes with a descriptive commit message.
steps.notes: Use conventional commit prefixes like feat:, fix:, or docs: for clarity.

steps.title: Push to remote
steps.description: Upload your branch to the remote repository.

steps.title: Create a pull request
steps.description: Now go to GitHub and open a pull request to merge your changes into main.

code.content: gh pr create --title "Add new feature" --body "Description here"

steps.notes: This requires the GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed.
